730828f.title: Bridges - High Bridge - [Harlem River - Looking toward Manhattan side and Highbridge Park from the Bronx.]
730828f.text:
High Bridge over the Harlem River, looking toward the Manhattan
side and Highbridge Park from the Bronx.

May Be Reproduced  About 1903

Neg # 356

730829f-a.title: Bridges - High Bridge - [Harlem River - Connecting Manhattan at 174th Street, Highbridge Park to the Bronx at about 170th Street.]
730829f-a.text:
(1)
High Bridge crosses the Harlem River, in connecting Manhattan at 174th Street, High Bridge Park to the Bronx at about 170th Street.
View is looking east to the Bronx, from Manhattan.
Summer 1923.
P. L. Sperr.
Ngg Nw N. 227
The same, from a slightly different angle.
Summer 1923.
P. L. Sperr.
,., Neg N 221
The same, from still another angle.
Summner 1923.
P. L. Sperr.

730830f-b.title: Bridges - High Bridge.
730830f-b.text:
(1)
High Bridge, followed by Washington Bridge, spans the Harlem
River.
August 31, 1926.
P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, from a slightly different angle.
August 31, 1926.
P. L. Sperr.

(3)
The same, from a further angle.
August 31, 1926.
P. L. Sperr.

730833f-b.title: Bridges - High Bridge - [Harlem River - Highbridge water tower.]
730833f-b.text:
(1)
High Bridge, east into the Bronx; from the Manhattan bluff. Also
seen is the water tower in foreground.
April 8, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same view, from below the Bridge.
April 8, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.

730827f-a.title: Bridges - High Bridge - [Across Harlem River, looking west towards Manhattan from Bronx shore].
730827f-a.text:
High Bridge across Harlem River, looking west towards Manhattan
from the Bronx shore. Two is the same.

View 1: Copyright 1893
by J. S. Johnston

View 2: Detroit Photo Company
Copyright

730831f-b.title: Bridges - High Bridge - [Spanning the Harlem River, and connecting the Bronx at about 170th Street to the Manhattan Highbridge Park at 174th Street.]
730831f-b.text:
High Bridge, spanning the Harlem River, and connecting the Bronx with Highbridge Park, Manhattan. View 1 shows one of the archways.
View 2 and 3 are looKing into the Bronx.
P. L. Sperr  View 1: 1936
View 2: 1937
View 3: 1940

730834f-a.title: Bridges - High Bridge - [Spans the Harlem River at the Manhattan 175th Street.]
730834f-a.text:
(1)
High Bridge, spans the Harlem River at 175th Street. The Washington Bridge is seen further nerth.
April 8, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.
(2) Approximately the same view, eleven years earlier.
October 1923.
Eugene L. Armbruster, Collection.

730835f-a.title: Bridges - High Bridge.
730835f-a.text:
(1)
High Bridge, after having had repairs and changes made to it.
September 16, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
A southward view of the north side of the same structure. Photographers vantage point is the Washington Bridge and shows High Bridge Park and Water
Tower on the right.
July 19, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
(No. 2, not a dry mount item).

730835f-b.text:

(No. 2, not a dry mount item).

730836f-b.title: Bridges - High Bridge - [Looking west across the Harlem River toward Highbridge Park, Manhattan from the Bronx.]
730836f-b.text:
High Bridge, looking west across the Harlem River toward Highbridge Park, Manhattan, from the Bronx shore.
View 2 is north on the river. Note the old water tower.
View 1: Eugene L. Armbruster Collection  1923
View 2: P. L. Sperr  1939
